page.title: 07FOOTPATHS IN CROWHURST
page.content: In May 1985 Class 7 of St. Stephen's School took the opportunity to walk many of the footpaths and bridleways to the villages of Tandridge and Crowhurst. In the bracing wind we found fields of corn,green vegetables and rape. We walked through a{Bluebell {Glade}which was thick with flower heads. We used styles to cross the{ {River Eden}and{Gibbs Brook.}Open grazing land had evidence of cows and rabbits.{Swallows,pheasants,plovers,} and{lapwings}were also spotted. We crossed the railway line to find{ {Crowhurst Church}and found the ancient {Yew tree}supported by brackets to support the weight of the branches. Down the road we saw the old village school. Its appearance had the recognisable features of the school but it had been transformed into a neatly decorated private house.
